Blacknightmare:

The femme arrived where Bullet was "I know that your comands are 
protect Chameleon, but this is the area of high risk labs until the 
virus dissapear we can't do nothing"

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Bullet quickly stopped, his momentum causing him to slide. 
BlackNightmare
> was his superior so he did as he was instructed. The bull 
transformed back
> to bot and took an immediate stance of respect for the other 
bot. "What
> about my orders to protect Chameleon?" he asked, torn between the 
orders
> he'd recieved. On one hand he would follow orders to protect the 
smaller bot
> and put the whole base at risk, or on the other hand he follows the 
orders
> to stop and admits failure.
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <airly2000@y...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 8:49 AM
> Subject: Re: The world hasn't crumbled yet?
> 
> 
> > Blacknightmare::
> >
> > Blacknightmare opened her comm link in Bullet's Frecuency, when 
she
> > saw Bullet ran where Chameleon was "Bullet, stop!!! the place is
> > blocked if you open it... ALL WILL BE IN THE PIT"
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > OOC I'm back, miss me?
> > >
> > > I leave for a short time and the world falls apart, guess I'll 
have
> > to bring some superglue.
> > >
> > > BIC
> > >
> > > Bullet exits his quarters fully recharged and ready to do his 
duty.
> > Even if his duty was to play nursemaid to a lizard. Being 
sentenced
> > to protect Chameleon was a fate worse than death. The bull 
would've
> > rather have faced a fireing squad than bear such indignity.
> > >
> > > Alarms sounded (Logically they'd go off since a virus had been
> > released.) chiming the release of a dangerous material into the 
ships
> > atmosphere. Bullet checked the computer for Chameleons 
location. "Why
> > am I not surprised?" he thought when he found that the bot he was 
to
> > protect was right in the middle of the action. He transformed to 
bull
> > and rushed through the halls toward the disturbance hoping the 
doors
> > to that level hadn't blocked it off to protect the rest of the 
ship.
> > >
> > >
